data.title: Premier and Football League transfers
data.meta_description: Definitive current and historical listings of player transfers and loans in the Premier League and Football League, for all clubs.
data.text:
Please select a filter.

Select additional filters to further refine your search results.

About transfer regulations

FIFAï¿½s Regulations on the Status and Transfer of Players stipulate that players may only be signed during one of two annual registration periods, commonly known as transfer windows.

A notable exception to this rule is that a player whose contract has expired prior to the end of a transfer window can be signed by another club before the opening of the next window as a free agent.

The dates and deadline time of a transfer window are decided by the relevant national association.

In England the summer window is usually 1 July to 31 August, and the mid-season window from 1 to 31 January.

Should the close of the transfer window fall on a weekend or bank holiday the deadline can be extended by a day.

In the Football League player loan transactions can be completed seven days after the close of a transfer window up to 5pm on the fourth Thursday in November in the first half of a season, and up to 5pm on the fourth Thursday in March in the second half of a season.
